What I'm Learning This Week:

  • JavaScript, JavaScript, & more JavaScript.

What I'm Reading This Week:

  • John Resig, Bear Bibeault, & Josip Maras, Secrets of the JavaScript Ninja.

What I'm Watching This Week:

  • In The Earth.
  • The Last Drive-In, S03E10 (Season Finale).

This Week's Hot Track:

Mondo Boys, "Find Me In The Fall"

This Week's Hot Laugh:

Community, "Paranormal Parentage" Things Clip

"Un site est jamais achevé — c’est toujours un accident qui le termine, c’est à dire qui le donne au public. Ce sont la lassitude, la demande de l’utilisateur, la poussée d’un autre site. Mais jamais l’état même de l’ouvrage (si le concepteur n’est pas un sot) ne montre qu’il ne pourrait être poussé, changé, considéré ce première approximation, ou origine d’une recherche nouvelle. Je conçois, quant à moi, que le même site et presque le même code pourraient être repris indéfiniment et occuper toute une vie. 'Perfection' c’est travail."

Paul Valéry Œuvres

Hello! My name is Larry.

I like making people laugh & building things people can use.

Click here to test this page's performance using Google's PageSpeed Insights.

I've been working as a front-end web developer for just over three years now. I love it! Building things that both delight users and help them find & do things on the World Wide Web is immensely fulfilling.

This is my personal website.

I'm an unapologetic '90s kid who (fondly) remembers GeoCities, LambdaMOO, and many other cultural artifacts of the Internet's dial-up days; and I've tried to incorporate those memories into this site's overall look & feel. This is purely a matter of personal taste and, though I hope it goes without saying, my aesthetic choices reflect what I happen to like. If I were building any other kind of a site, especially for a client or employer, it would look very different! (If you want to see some examples of what "very different" looks like, check out the My Work section of this site, linked below.)

NAV INSTRUCTIONS:

This website is organized into different sections.

You can learn more about each section by reading the cards below. If you'd like to navigate to a particular section, simply click on the hyperlinks embedded within each card. Your browser should take care of the rest!

To navigate to an individual card, you can either click on one of the short links beneath the gray line (which will auto scroll to the selected card) or, if you'd like to go at a more leisurely pace, you can manually scroll down the page until you see a card that piques your interest.

You can return to this menu by clicking on the blue chevrons at the bottom of each section's card.

This site is perpetually under construction, which means some sections might not be "live" yet. If so, attempting to navigate to them will also redirect you back to this nav menu. Go raibh míle maith agaibh for you patience!

My Web Dev JourneyMy WorkWeb Dev Learning ResourcesWhat I UseSnippetsCSS LabJavaScript LabCoding Rules & AssumptionsING SystemPolymathyThe Conspiracy Against LarryPersonal Rules & AssumptionsCommonplace Book

My Web Dev Journey

I wasn't always a web developer. It took me a while to get here, and I learned a lot of valuable things along the way.

My Work

My professional work & side projects can all be found here, as well as my resume & other material I've created to help HR professionals (or anyone else dragooned into HR-related work) get a better sense of who I am, what I know, how I add value, & how I can help organizations reach their goals.

Available For Hire!

Web Dev Learning Resources

The best web devs are constantly pushing themselves to learn new things, including new things about what they "already" know. Without the right tools, resources, methods, & techniques, that can be incredibly (and needlessly) challenging. Here you can find the resources I used to teach myself web development, as well the resources I use to continue building out of my knowledge as a web developer.

What I Use

A semi-exhaustive rundown of the tools, applications, & systems I lean on to help me get the most out of my day-to-day work. This section also provides details on tools I'm using on a trial basis, tools I intend to try in the not-too-distant future, and "legacy" tools I no longer use. Real nerd stuff.

Snippets

A collection of somewhat useful, always interesting, smaller-than-a-bread-box-sized chunks of code I've created, adapted, or gently tweaked to help me tackle specific problems and use cases. Some of these began as "experiments" in my CSS & JS Labs. Most of these can also be found on my Codepen profile.

CSS Lab

This is where all my CSS "experiments" live. It includes links to the Pinterest boards (and other resources) I use to generate ideas for CSS Lab projects.

JavaScript Lab

This is where all my JavaScript (& JavaScript framework) "experiments" live. It also includes (very rough) notes on "reach" projects I hope to tackle as my JS skills improve.

Coding Rules & Assumptions

An ever-expanding collection of rules & assumptions I use to guide my work as a developer, complete with citations, underlying logic, and use case examples.

ING System

The "ING System" is my own, highly syncretic personal productivity system. Like everything else on this site, it's constantly under development, but, at base, the -ING system is about creating, leveraging, & iterating processes that ask & answer one simple question: "Why am I do-ing right now?".

In my experience, this is an incredibly important, but also a surprisingly difficult, question to answer!

Polymathy

My life goal is to become a polymath. I use this section of my site to organize, document, & share my progress towards that goal. It includes both general learning-how-to-learn resources, as well as sections devoted to the specific fields I've studied and/or I'm currently learning.


Please note that nothing web dev related can be found here: I've organized all that material in the Web Dev Learning Resources. section of this site.

The Conspiracy Against Larry

There's a good reason you've never heard of the vast, worldwide conspiracy working tirelessly to discredit and ridicule Larrys everywhere: it doesn't actually exist. Unless, of course, it does?

Personal Rules & Assumptions

An ever-expanding collection of rules & assumptions I use to structure my day-to-day living & thinking. These work for me; they may not work for you. Take what you can use & ignore the rest.

Commonplace Book

A collection of quotes, anecdotes, observations, information, & other errata I've gleaned from books, conversations, movies, song lyrics, social posts, podcasts, life experiences, & everything else.

You're currently viewing the mobile version of my homepage. That's totally fine, but you should seriously considering viewing this site on a larger screen if you want the full "larrymg.me" experience!
